title: (x) 60’s fonts with flourishes - Cabernet Swash, Ziggurat {Luke, Ben}
content:
Hi,

I’m looking to identify these two fonts (top&bottom). Also, anyone knows a similar font to top one with nice flourishes. Thanks very much !

Jenn

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [jenn\_id\_it.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130313112530/http:/typophile.com/files/jenn_id_it.jpg) | 38.61 KB |
author: jennifer_mbx

comments.content: Not quite like the samples, but there's always [Bookman Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20130313112530/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085).

I think the first one is Cabernet Swash - [http://www.fontfactory.com/font\_info.php/font\_id/6930/manufacturers\_id/8...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130313112530/http:/www.fontfactory.com/font_info.php/font_id/6930/manufacturers_id/82?sid=5213c7a375340db3daa1019a29f7a329 "http://www.fontfactory.com/font\_info.php/font\_id/6930/manufacturers\_id/82?sid=5213c7a375340db3daa1019a29f7a329")

Thanks, top one is definitely Cabernet Swash, what about the bottom one ??(you can ignore the black outlines, these I think were done manually)

The hunt is still on....

Cheers !
